TopicTitle: I don't know who this is, but...

Articles.Content:
Browsing Imgur today, and I found this gem (with ~275,000 views and 1,465 points):

Anyone know who took this, and whether or not they're on the Forum? I just wanted to tell them that, despite the title of the Imgur post, they're not as obsessed as some (me).

You may now resume your normal, day-to-day Forum page viewing.

That's mine!

Oh wait the board and numbers are much too small to be mine.

I'm curious what some of that other unmentionable stuff is laying around?

Can I see your license and registration please?
This is probably still on the first page or two of the KSP subreddit, if anyone's really curious about the source.
wow this makes my set up for gaming look like a calculator stand
I want to be like that person.
That kinda reminds me of this:

I'm curious what some of that other unmentionable stuff is laying around?

Looks like some bottles of e-cigarette juice to me on the far left.

I saw this too. It doesn't look as over the top as people are making it out to be. There's the delta-V map for the Kerbol system on the board, with biome names and what I'm guessing are ships at the top right and bottom left of that board. Then there's a picture of a completed tech tree on the tablet that's probably from the wiki. The most obsessed thing I see is the binder with tabs for maps and planet stats for each body which I think is a pretty good idea, actually.

Overall neat, but not really anything to freak out over.

well, it sure looks impressive at first glance, but then scribbling on the walls will always add a certain je ne sais quoi to your madness. I prefer to keep my madness digitized and on a second screen, at least that way I can hide it when I hear someone comming.

I don't see the big deal either. All of my similar scrawlings and engineering notes are in a spiral bound notebook beside my joystick.

Best,

-Slashy

I have all of that info in conveniently bookmarked links or in insite images and play with two screens, with the second screen to display that info at need ( and OFC a app to keep the game onscreen while alt-tabbing ) . I just need to make a clean xls file about the new part costs ...
